intro: Morinda alyxioides, commonly known as the African wolfberry, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red or orange berries that are edible and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry or semi-arid environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants.
